page.title: 18TRAFFIC SURVEY COWPEN BLYTH.
page.content: Two roads run on two sides of Bebside Middle School: the A189 a dual carriageway which is the main arterial road of S.E.Northumberland and the A193 (a single carriageway) linking the A189 with the town of Blyth and more especially Bates Colliery. It was noted after two surveys in the early afternoon of two weekdays that the minor road ,A193, was more heavily used by both cars and commercial vehicles.The H.G.V. rate for this road was 30% of the total usage, with approximately 33% of these transporting coal from the colliery or returning empty. The A193 is immediately outside the school gates. Between 900 to 1000 vehicles pass the gates each hour with 296 H.G.V.'s per hour during the school day.
